org.lwjgl.ovr

Class OVRTrackingState

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.system.PointerWrapper
      • org.lwjgl.system.Struct
        • org.lwjgl.ovr.OVRTrackingState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pointer

    public class OVRTrackingState
extends Struct
    Tracking state at a given absolute time (describes predicted HMD pose etc). Returned by OVR.ovr_GetTrackingState(long, double, boolean, org.lwjgl.ovr.OVRTrackingState).

    ovrTrackingState members

    MemberTypeDescription
    HeadPoseovrPoseStatefPredicted head pose (and derivatives) at the requested absolute time. The look-ahead interval is equal to (HeadPose.TimeInSeconds - RawSensorData.TimeInSeconds).
    CameraPoseovrPosefCurrent pose of the external camera (if present). This pose includes camera tilt (roll and pitch). For a leveled coordinate system use LeveledCameraPose.
    LeveledCameraPoseovrPosefCamera frame aligned with gravity. This value includes position and yaw of the camera, but not roll and pitch. It can be used as a reference point to render real-world objects in the correct location.
    HandPosesovrPoseStatef[2]The most recent calculated pose for each hand when hand controller tracking is present. HandPoses[ovrHand_Left] refers to the left hand and HandPoses[ovrHand_Right] to the right hand. These values can be combined with ovrInputState for complete hand controller information.
    RawSensorDataovrSensorDatathe most recent sensor data received from the HMD
    StatusFlagsunsigned inttracking status described by ovrStatusBits
    HandStatusFlagsunsigned int[2]hand status flags described by ovrStatusBits. Only OVR.ovrStatus_OrientationTracked and OVR.ovrStatus_PositionTracked are reported.
    LastCameraFrameCounteruint32_ttag the vision processing results to a certain frame counter number

      • OVRTrackingState

        public OVRTrackingState(java.nio.ByteBuffer container)
        Creates a OVRTrackingState instance at the current position of the specified ByteBuffer container. Changes to the buffer's content will be visible to the struct instance and vice versa.

        The created instance holds a strong reference to the container object.
